conversion_verification.notes: Second image shows extruded walls with thickness, visible side/top faces, perceptible room volumes, an elevated angled view, and a clean roof/ceiling cutaway exposing the interior.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear 3D extrusion and readable volumes; cutaway is clean. View is slightly near-top-down but still angled; minor simplification at some wall corners/joins.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall apartment layout (living/dining at top, kitchen left, two bedrooms bottom corners, baths) matches well with correct adjacencies. Some openings/closet details and a few wall segment lengths appear simplified compared to the 2D plan.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture and fixtures are present: sofas/coffee table, dining table, kitchen counters/appliances, beds, and bathroom fixtures. Minor simplification in cabinetry/fixture detail and exact placement.

visual_clarity.notes: Walls/floors/openings are clearly distinguishable with good lighting and minimal artifacts; presentation is clean with no visible UI/text overlay in the 3D render.

detected_errors.description: Minor layout proportional differences: some wall lengths/partition extents appear slightly adjusted/simplified relative to the 2D plan.
Some door/window/closet opening positions and proportions appear simplified and may not exactly match the 2D drawing.

summary: A true 3D cutaway conversion with strong overall layout fidelity, with only minor proportional and opening-placement simplifications versus the 2D plan.
